subject: Re: [junit] Logger in a JUnit test don't log with Ant?!
msgSnippet: You d probably have more joy posting on the ant-users list, and include the (relevant part of) build.xml so that people can see what the  task is
messageBody:
You'd probably have more joy posting on the ant-users list, and include the
(relevant part of) build.xml so that people can see what the <junit/> task
is doing.

Cheers,

James

On 18/09/06, Charles Tuckey <charles@...> wrote:
>
> How are you configuring log4j to write to a file? If you are using a
> configuration file perhaps under Ant it is not reading the
> configuration file?
>
> charlie
>
> On 9/15/06, isowitz <isowitz@... <isowitz%40yahoo.com>> wrote:
> > I wrote a JUnit test where I used java.util.logging.Logger to put some
> > information in a file. If I start that JUnit test with Eclipse or on
> > the console with java TheJunitTest all works fine and the log will
> > created.
> > But if I start that JUnit test within an ant build.xml no log from my
> > logger is created.
> >
> > And I don't know why. Any suggestions?
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >

>
> --
> Regards,
> Charlie
>
>
